tournament.name: Monday 2nd Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to maintain tempo and control the board by playing aggressive creatures with flash and utilizing counter spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By having a mix of evasive creatures like Sea-Dasher Octopus and Brazen Borrower, along with card advantage engines like Slitherwisp and Spectral Sailor, the deck aims to outvalue opponents while applying pressure on the board. The inclusion of Lochmere Serpent provides a finisher that can also help control the opponent's resources. The mana base is designed to smoothly cast the deck's spells and maintain consistency in the early game.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Fires of Invention to gain advantage. It also includes cards like Deafening Clarion and Mystical Dispute to deal with threats. The deck utilizes powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Sphinx of Foresight, Cavalier of Flame, and Kenrith, the Returned King to close out the game. The mana base consists of a variety of lands to ensure consistency in casting spells. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion provides additional card advantage in longer games.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells without paying their mana costs, allowing the player to gain control of the game by playing threats like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King. The deck also includes powerful control elements such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion to help stabilize the board and protect the player's life total. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion provides additional card advantage to ensure the player has resources to maintain control of the game.

This deck focuses on aggressive early game plays with cards like Cauldron Familiar and Fiend Artisan to pressure the opponent. The deck also aims to create value with sacrificing creatures using cards like Witch's Oven and Priest of Forgotten Gods. By utilizing the graveyard with cards like Call of the Death-Dweller and Lurrus of the Dream-Den, the deck can continue to apply pressure even if its creatures are removed. The mix of sacrifice effects, recursion, and aggressive creatures allows this deck to quickly overwhelm opponents and control the board.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Nightpack Ambusher and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Wilderness Reclamation to cast big spells like Expansion / Explosion. It also includes a variety of versatile counterspells like Mystical Dispute and Negate to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the board and winning through card advantage and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, allowing for efficient control of the board with cards like Cavalier of Flame and Deafening Clarion. The deck also incorporates powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way to help dig for key pieces and maintain control of the game. The goal is to stay ahead of the opponent by utilizing powerful creatures and spells while managing resources effectively through the use of Fires of Invention.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells for free. The deck focuses on powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Sarkhan the Masterless, along with board wipes like Deafening Clarion and Shatter the Sky to keep the opponent's creatures in check. Cards like Narset of the Ancient Way and Whirlwind of Thought provide card advantage and synergy with the control strategy. Additionally, Fae of Wishes allows the deck to access a sideboard filled with useful cards for various situations.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, allowing the player to maintain control of the game by playing multiple threats and answers in a single turn. By ramping into big threats like Cavalier of Flame and Kenrith, the Returned King, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent while also controlling the board with sweepers like Deafening Clarion and removal like Bonecrusher Giant. Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way provide additional control elements, while the deck also includes card draw and selection with Sphinx of Foresight and Castle Vantress.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by sacrificing creatures with effects like Trail of Crumbs, Witch's Oven, and Cauldron Familiar to generate value and deal damage to the opponent with cards like Mayhem Devil and Korvold, Fae-Cursed King. The deck focuses on utilizing cards that provide synergy with sacrificing creatures, while also including removal spells like Heartless Act and mass removal with cards like Massacre Girl. Additionally, Obosh, the Preypiercer provides additional damage when odd-costed cards are played.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent using low-cost, evasive creatures like Spectral Sailor and Sea-Dasher Octopus. The deck also utilizes counterspells like Quench and Mystical Dispute to control the board and protect its threats. With cards like Brineborn Cutthroat and Brazen Borrower providing additional tempo plays, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruption while maintaining a solid mana base with 20 Islands.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with low-cost creatures and then utilize sacrifice effects to generate value and drain the opponent's life total. By combining cards like Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven with sacrifice outlets like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Fiend Artisan, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while steadily building towards a lethal finish. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion further enhances the deck's ability to recur creatures and maintain a strong board presence throughout the game.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar, Priest of Forgotten Gods, and Witch's Oven to create a recurring sacrifice loop that puts constant pressure on the opponent while generating card advantage. The deck also includes aggressive creatures like Dreadhorde Butcher, Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, and Serrated Scorpion to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. With a low mana curve and a fast playstyle, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and resource denial.

This red aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with fast and efficient creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to establish a board presence early with cards like Fervent Champion and Robber of the Rich, then finish off the opponent with high damage output from Embercleave and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell. The inclusion of cards like Runaway Steam-Kin and Anax, Hardened in the Forge provide additional synergy and resilience in the deck. With a low mana curve and aggressive tactics, this deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

Utilize ramp and card draw to control the game and generate mana advantage with Wilderness Reclamation, while countering opposing threats with counterspells and removal. The goal is to efficiently answer threats and pressure the opponent with powerful finishers like Expansion / Explosion, Uro, and Brazen Borrower. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by constantly drawing cards and generating mana, leading to overwhelming advantage and inevitably winning through either burn spells or beatdown with powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By combining cheap spells like Shock and Quench with powerful creatures like Crackling Drake and Sprite Dragon, the deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible. The inclusion of card draw spells like Opt and Winged Words helps to ensure a steady stream of threats and answers. With a mix of burn, counter spells, and flying creatures, this deck is designed to apply constant pressure and outpace the opponent.

The main idea of this UW Control deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck aims to stall the game with Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils while setting up for powerful late-game plays with cards like Dream Trawler and Elspeth Conquers Death. The deck also utilizes cards like Shark Typhoon and Omen of the Sea for card draw and additional threats. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and ultimately win through attrition and powerful finishers.
